reviews.review_msg: One of the best professors at SFU. Andrea is super passionate about the subjects she teaches and her lectures are amazing. She's super caring and accessible outside of class to chat or if you need help. Be prepared to read a lot but if you're interested in the subject it won't be bad at all.
Worst prof ever at SFU, she expects too much from students, there are around 100 pages per week where you have to read.

This course was way too much work for a 200 level course. I took this in my last semester of my undergrad and it was harder than my 400 level seminars. The exams expected way too much out of us in one sitting and she is absolutely crazy about citations. As an English student I've never had a prof dock so many marks for citations.

Ms. Matsumura is a really solid choice (maybe the only choice) for HIST206. Her lectures are clear and concise, and she does have a passion for what she's teaching. Grading on written assignments is a bit harsh, but never unfair. I'd say that passing the course is easy, but getting a good grade is not. Be prepared to read and work hard!
Not the most engaging of speakers, but provides interesting material so as to keep your attention. Fair marker. I'd definitely take more classes with her.

She makes this class way too hard for a second year course. Because of her vast knowledge of Japanese history she expects students to have a concise understanding of the course's topics. The class is not worth it when she is teaching. Tutorials are completely pointless but mandatory.
She is interested in what she teaches and communicates in a clear manner. But the tutorials do not have enough class participation and she does not bother to learn students names
She needs to lighten up on the grading. This is only a 2nd year class. Though see does know her stuff, she does not seem very interested in the subject matter. Her tutorials are useless.

I'd take Janice again for sure. She's picky about bibliography stuff, WAY more than other profs but that's my only complaint. Good tutorials, easy to talk to about papers. Hard marker but not at all unfair. One of the best I've had at SFU.

Janice is great, I'd recommend her to anyone. She is funny, while at the same time able to get lots of info across. She's also really easy to talk to about term paper's, exams etc. Tough marker, but not unfair.
Great Prof, very interesting and informative but the final was a bit harder than expected.
Enjoyed the class a lot, marked the final extremely easy, made the material very interesting.
Easy to understand lectures and fair marker
Very Easy; Looks too much like a man; Cool Prof
